dta.RoadNode¶

class RoadNode(id, x, y, geometryType, control, priority, label=None, level=None)¶

Bases: dta.Node.Node

A Node subclass that represents a road node in a network.

Note

lmz has read over this, so todos are marked.

Constructor.

  • id is a unique identifier (unique within the containing network), an integer
  • x and y are coordinates in the units specified by Node.COORDINATE_UNITS
  • geometryType is one of Node.GEOMETRY_TYPE_INTERSECTION or Node.GEOMETRY_TYPE_JUNCTION
  • control is one of RoadNode.CONTROL_TYPE_UNSIGNALIZED or RoadNode.CONTROL_TYPE_SIGNALIZED
  • priority is one of
    • RoadNode.PRIORITY_TEMPLATE_NONE
    • RoadNode.PRIORITY_TEMPLATE_AWSC
    • RoadNode.PRIORITY_TEMPLATE_TWSC
    • RoadNode.PRIORITY_TEMPLATE_ROUNDABOUT
    • RoadNode.PRIORITY_TEMPLATE_MERGE
    • RoadNode.PRIORITY_TEMPLATE_SIGNALIZED
  • label is a string, for readability. If None passed, will default to “label [id]”
  • level is for vertical alignment. More details TBD. If None passed, will use default.
__init__(id, x, y, geometryType, control, priority, label=None, level=None)¶

Constructor.

  • id is a unique identifier (unique within the containing network), an integer
  • x and y are coordinates in the units specified by Node.COORDINATE_UNITS
  • geometryType is one of Node.GEOMETRY_TYPE_INTERSECTION or Node.GEOMETRY_TYPE_JUNCTION
  • control is one of RoadNode.CONTROL_TYPE_UNSIGNALIZED or RoadNode.CONTROL_TYPE_SIGNALIZED
  • priority is one of
    • RoadNode.PRIORITY_TEMPLATE_NONE
    • RoadNode.PRIORITY_TEMPLATE_AWSC
    • RoadNode.PRIORITY_TEMPLATE_TWSC
    • RoadNode.PRIORITY_TEMPLATE_ROUNDABOUT
    • RoadNode.PRIORITY_TEMPLATE_MERGE
    • RoadNode.PRIORITY_TEMPLATE_SIGNALIZED
  • label is a string, for readability. If None passed, will default to “label [id]”
  • level is for vertical alignment. More details TBD. If None passed, will use default.

CONTROL_TYPES = [0, 1]¶

all control types

CONTROL_TYPE_SIGNALIZED = 1¶

the intersection is signalized

CONTROL_TYPE_UNSIGNALIZED = 0¶

the intersection is not signalized

COORDINATE_UNITS = None¶
DEFAULT_LABEL = ''¶
DEFAULT_LEVEL = 0¶
GEOMETRY_TYPES = [1, 2, 99, 100]¶
GEOMETRY_TYPE_CENTROID = 100¶
GEOMETRY_TYPE_INTERSECTION = 1¶
GEOMETRY_TYPE_JUNCTION = 2¶
GEOMETRY_TYPE_VIRTUAL = 99¶
PRIORITY_TEMPLATES = [0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 11]¶

For each control type, a list of available Capacity/Priority templates is provided. Choosing a template from the list will automatically provide follow-up time values with corresponding permitted capacity values in the movements table below, and define all movement priority relationships at the node with corresponding gap acceptance values.

PRIORITY_TEMPLATE_AWSC = 1¶

All Way Stop Control - an intersection with a stop sign on every approach

PRIORITY_TEMPLATE_MERGE = 4¶

An uncontrolled (unsignalized) junction at which a minor street must yield to the major street, which may or may not be explicitly marked with a Yield sign.

PRIORITY_TEMPLATE_NONE = 0¶

No template: either a signalized or unsignalized junction, where there is no yielding of any kind, and the permitted capacity is equal to the protected capacity.

PRIORITY_TEMPLATE_ROUNDABOUT = 3¶

A junction on a roundabout at which vehicles enter the roundabout. Vehicles entering the roundabout must yield to those already on the roundabout (by convention in most countries).

PRIORITY_TEMPLATE_SIGNALIZED = 11¶

Any signalized intersection (three-leg, four-leg, etc.). For right-side driving, left-turn movements yield to opposing through traffic and right turns, and right turns yield to the conflicting through traffic (if applicable). For left-side driving, the rules are the same but reversed.

PRIORITY_TEMPLATE_TWSC = 2¶

Two Way Stop Control - an intersection at which a minor street crosses a major street and only the minor street is stop-controlled

_addIncomingLink(link)¶

Verify that the given link ends in this node, and adds it to the list of incoming links.

_addOutgoingLink(link)¶

Verify that the given link starts with this node, and adds it to the list of outgoing links.

_getMinAngle(node1, edge1, node2, edge2)¶

Returns a positive number in degrees within [0, 180] that corresponds to the angle between the two edges.

_removeIncomingLink(link)¶

Simple removal.

_removeOutgoingLink(link)¶

Simple removal.

addTimePlan(timePlan, raiseValidateError=False)¶

Add the given timePlan, an instance of TimePlan, to the current collection.

This method will call TimePlan.validate() If raiseValidateError, any errors will be raised; otherwise they will just be warned.

control¶

Returns the control at this road node, one of RoadNode.CONTROL_TYPE_UNSIGNALIZED or CONTROL_TYPE_SIGNALIZED

geometryType¶

Returns the geometry type for this node, one of Node.GEOMETRY_TYPE_INTERSECTION, Node.GEOMETRY_TYPE_JUNCTION, Node.GEOMETRY_TYPE_VIRTUAL or Node.GEOMETRY_TYPE_CENTROID.

getCandidateLinksForSplitting(connector, disallowConnectorEvalStr)¶

Given a Connector instance whose start node or end node is the calling instance, returns a list of RoadLink instances where:

  • The link is at least 0.009 miles long (why?)
  • If disallowConnectorEvalStr, then it evaluates as False for a RoadLink (using RoadLink.disallowSplitForConnector()
  • If one were to create a new link between the connector‘s VirtualNode and the midpoint of the link, none of the other RoadLink instances adjacent to the calling node would cross it.

The returned list is sorted by euclidean length, longest to shortest.

getCardinality()¶

Return a pair of numbers representing the number of incoming and outgoing links respectively.

getId()¶

Returns the integer id for this node.

getIncomingLinkForId(linkId)¶

Returns an incoming link if one has an ID matching linkId. It no incoming links qualify, raises a DtaError.

getIncomingLinkForNodeId(nodeId)¶

Returns an incoming link if one starts from nodeId. It no incoming links qualify, raises a DtaError.

getLabel()¶

Return the node label

getMovement(startNodeId, endNodeId)¶

Return the Movement from the start node identified by the startNodeId to the end node identified by the endNodeId that goes through this node.

getMovementForLinkIds(incomingLinkId, outgoingLinkId)¶

Return the Movement with incoming and outgoing links specified by incomingLinkId and outgoingLinkId.

getName()¶

Return the name of the intersection as a string consisting of the upper-cased labels of the incoming links in sorted order, separated by AND. (e.g. VAN NESS AVE AND MARKET ST)

getNumAdjacentLinks()¶

Returns the number of links adjacent to this node (either incoming or outgoing).

getNumAdjacentNodes()¶

Return the number of nodes that are connected to this node.

getNumAdjacentRoadLinks()¶

Returns the number of RoadLink instances adjacent to this node (either incoming or outgoing).

getNumAdjacentRoadNodes()¶

Return the number of RoadNode instances that share a link with this node.

getNumIncomingLinks()¶

Returns the number of incoming links.

getNumMovements()¶

Return the number of Movement instances associated with this node.

getNumOutgoingLinks()¶

Returns the number of outgoing links.

getOrientation(point)¶

Return the clockwise angle from the North measured in degrees of the line segment that has the current node as its start and the given point as its end.

getStreetNames(incoming=True, outgoing=False)¶

Return the street names (labels) of the relevant links as a sorted upper-case list.

getTimePlan(planInfo)¶

Return the TimePlan for the specific time period defined by planInfo, an instance of PlanCollectionInfo.

getX()¶

Returns the x-coordinate for this node.

getY()¶

Returns the y-coordinate for this node.

hasConnector()¶

Return True if there is a connector attached to the node.

hasIncomingLinkForId(linkId)¶

Returns True if there is an incoming link with the given linkId.

hasIncomingLinkForNodeId(nodeId)¶

Returns True if there is an incoming link starting from nodeId.

hasMovement(startNodeId, endNodeId)¶

Return True if a Movement exists from the node with startNodeId through this node to the node with endNodeId, and if that movement is not prohibited.

hasOutgoingLinkForId(linkId)¶

Returns True if there is an outgoing link with the given linkId.

hasOutgoingLinkForNodeId(nodeId)¶

Returns True if there is an outgoing link towards a node with the given nodeId.

hasTimePlan(planInfo=None)¶

Return True if the node has at least one TimePlan.

isCentroid()¶

Return True if this Node is a Centroid

isIntersection()¶

Return True if this node is an intersection

isJunction(countRoadNodesOnly=False)¶

Return True if this node is a junction.

isMidblockNode(countRoadNodesOnly=False)¶

Return True if the node is a shape point (e.g. Node 51245 in the following graph). Specifically, a node is a shape point iff:

  • it has exactly two adjacent nodes and
  • it has either two (in the case one a one-way street) or four (in the case of a two way street) adjacent links

If countRoadNodesOnly is True the method will count only adjacent RoadNode instances and adjacent RoadLink instances (so it will disregard any connectors).

isOverlapping(link, minAngle)¶

Returns True if the minimum angle between the input link and any similarly oriented link of the intersection is less than the input minAngle, which is specified in degrees.

By “similarly oriented”, the method looks at all other incoming links if link is incoming, and all other outgoing links if link is outgoing to this node. If link is neither incoming nor outgoing to this node, raises a DtaError.

isRoadNode()¶

Return True if this Node is a RoadNode.

isVirtualNode()¶

Return True if this Node is a VirtualNode

iterAdjacentLinks()¶

Return an iterator to all Link instances adjacent (incoming or outgoing) to this node

iterAdjacentNodes()¶

Return an iterator to the adjacent Node instances.

iterAdjacentRoadLinks()¶

Return an iterator to all RoadLink instances adjacent to this node (excluding Connectors)

iterAdjacentRoadNodes()¶

Return an iterator to all RoadNode instances adjacent to this Node

iterDownstreamNodes()¶

Returns an iterator to the end nodes of all outgoing links.

iterIncomingLinks()¶

Returns iterator for the incoming links.

iterLinks()¶

Returns an iterator to all adjacent links.

iterMovements()¶

Return an iterator to all the Movement instances going through the node.

iterOutgoingLinks()¶

Returns iterator for the outgoing links.

iterTimePlans()¶

Return an iterator over the TimePlan instances corresponding to this node.

iterUpstreamNodes()¶

Returns an iterator to the start nodes of all incoming links.

priority¶

Returns the priority at this road node, one of RoadNode.PRIORITY_TEMPLATE_NONE, RoadNode.PRIORITY_TEMPLATE_AWSC, RoadNode.PRIORITY_TEMPLATE_TWSC, RoadNode.PRIORITY_TEMPLATE_ROUNDABOUT, RoadNode.PRIORITY_TEMPLATE_MERGE, or RoadNode.PRIORITY_TEMPLATE_SIGNALIZED.

setAllWayStopControl()¶

Sets the road node’s stop control to all way stop.

Raises an error if it was already marked as signalized.

setPriorityTemplateNone()¶

Sets the road node’s priority template to RoadNode.PRIORITY_TEMPLATE_NONE.

setTwoWayStopControl()¶

Sets the road node’s stop control to two way stop.

Raises an error if it was already marked as signalized.
